intro: Manettia acutiflora, commonly known as the sharp-flowered manettia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers that bloom throughout the year. Its leaves are typically elliptical and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Manettia acutiflora is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its delicate appearance and ability to thrive in shaded environments.
